<span key="55f139e1ea564e6da54ac16943fb37aa"><span offset-key="55f139e1ea564e6da54ac16943fb37aa:0">Main article: </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d78363ed38b84554b3fd9acbc23c7080" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="ec16398f4e8841a089b7e9184a3500e3"><span data-offset-key="ec16398f4e8841a089b7e9184a3500e3:0">Assembly language</span></span></span></a><span key="1265996b2b7b450ea6f9f8ea3ad4978c"><span offset-key="1265996b2b7b450ea6f9f8ea3ad4978c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="82a8a863e35240b6919918ed67464e87"><span offset-key="82a8a863e35240b6919918ed67464e87:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d7d642cd616549d18e2c68d00c33d929" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="c107a243d4a64929b50c4e0f1c5f7a29"><span data-offset-key="c107a243d4a64929b50c4e0f1c5f7a29:0">Assembly languages</span></span></span></a><span key="520685691c7647febe4e86e9fd699579"><span offset-key="520685691c7647febe4e86e9fd699579:0"> directly correspond to a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machine_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="deb564fe92694f78bde6ca9850462f63" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="07127a3c6bc8489ebdc24ec713c7cbb7"><span data-offset-key="07127a3c6bc8489ebdc24ec713c7cbb7:0">machine language</span></span></span></a><span key="cf112ca8cdb24cf489294484754c97ca"><span offset-key="cf112ca8cdb24cf489294484754c97ca:0"> (see </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_programming_languages_by_type#Machine_languages" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="90e033e51e684b1fa958a15d238b44d8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="5e5b49828277466eb89c5b0e08f4f725"><span data-offset-key="5e5b49828277466eb89c5b0e08f4f725:0">below</span></span></span></a><span key="b39bab63efb840c1bdd35d971fc4392e"><span offset-key="b39bab63efb840c1bdd35d971fc4392e:0">), although there may not be a 1-1 mapping between an individual statement and an individual instruction, so machine code instructions appear in a form understandable by humans. Assembly languages let programmers use symbolic addresses, which the </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_language_assembler" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1968a20bf1de4fa49bd06d35263ae26b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="6edb57a702294919843baddd4ffacc15"><span data-offset-key="6edb57a702294919843baddd4ffacc15:0">assembler</span></span></span></a><span key="cadb259a679f427b8201dc86087cb8d9"><span offset-key="cadb259a679f427b8201dc86087cb8d9:0"> converts to absolute or </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relocation_(computing)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="bd86a6ae1e784cb7aa48d5efdd56cff2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="56d11db2c69f449588704776191327b5"><span data-offset-key="56d11db2c69f449588704776191327b5:0">relocatable</span></span></span></a><span key="99115e71c2c04b0790fbb94349fed3c5"><span offset-key="99115e71c2c04b0790fbb94349fed3c5:0"> addresses. Most assemblers also support </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macro_(computer_science)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="bd30fe165d484106b44f29de2060fe32" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="61fc8698539a4746b21646ce2797f31b"><span data-offset-key="61fc8698539a4746b21646ce2797f31b:0">macros</span></span></span></a><span key="3814514943df42b5a0bf009d4da2ba58"><span offset-key="3814514943df42b5a0bf009d4da2ba58:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constant_(computer_programming)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a6d34dd3ce3f49e1b6a0508027cb07eb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="72aa5e42cf854e3da51fddeda5778969"><span data-offset-key="72aa5e42cf854e3da51fddeda5778969:0">symbolic constants</span></span></span></a><span key="580da52b1f8145a79c1b4fe73d455528"><span offset-key="580da52b1f8145a79c1b4fe73d455528:0">.</span></span>

<span key="bf0659be264642f69f84e0b1d1d38bb1"><span offset-key="bf0659be264642f69f84e0b1d1d38bb1:0">Main article: </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constraint_programming" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="479d0f0db6284927bbf22a72344bf70c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="18b97de16dfe4e15bbf5b6e0fdd504f3"><span data-offset-key="18b97de16dfe4e15bbf5b6e0fdd504f3:0">Constraint programming</span></span></span></a><span key="ecda5b582d934456900f1caae7486ebd"><span offset-key="ecda5b582d934456900f1caae7486ebd:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span>

<span key="08b58a37acd34069b48093832972c33b"><span offset-key="08b58a37acd34069b48093832972c33b:0">A </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constraint_programming_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="405f8435d26f4443baca4b5112485a7c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="693f7e31c3244f95b72ba2aaf611ead6"><span data-offset-key="693f7e31c3244f95b72ba2aaf611ead6:0">constraint programming language</span></span></span></a><span key="41f367a2501a4941b6b780b428027f8c"><span offset-key="41f367a2501a4941b6b780b428027f8c:0"> is a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Declarative_programming_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b1d39c3d607c425682a1b689524340f8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="953aaff6c31748329dead638aec446bf"><span data-offset-key="953aaff6c31748329dead638aec446bf:0">declarative programming language</span></span></span></a><span key="a0a455f026b8442dbef11ee2faf68ee0"><span offset-key="a0a455f026b8442dbef11ee2faf68ee0:0"> where relationships between variables are expressed as </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constraint_(mathematics)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d7a0f41bd5d0460b95d347a61c39170f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="a19bcd7ffe7b42eebd1d4be5eec88c66"><span data-offset-key="a19bcd7ffe7b42eebd1d4be5eec88c66:0">constraints</span></span></span></a><span key="dfe7fbeaac52453b90b93faa23795446"><span offset-key="dfe7fbeaac52453b90b93faa23795446:0">. Execution proceeds by attempting to find values for the variables which satisfy all declared constraints.</span></span>

<span key="38eceb89c8714eca89d829a9c53ef1f9"><span offset-key="38eceb89c8714eca89d829a9c53ef1f9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Message_passing" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="487db5783db74465b0d6d9af3e40a9f7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="0c1042884f634fd28155e33432021ccd"><span data-offset-key="0c1042884f634fd28155e33432021ccd:0">Message passing</span></span></span></a><span key="c5566ebe02a64e0583eadef5dcdb0d42"><span offset-key="c5566ebe02a64e0583eadef5dcdb0d42:0"> languages provide language constructs for </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Concurrency_(computer_science)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e1b4f3027bfe48f281fae7a366fe7eb0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="3aff4ef07ecd4479ac76d41e9d3231e5"><span data-offset-key="3aff4ef07ecd4479ac76d41e9d3231e5:0">concurrency</span></span></span></a><span key="00afe125c6aa4c9f968292a23387c2de"><span offset-key="00afe125c6aa4c9f968292a23387c2de:0">. The predominant paradigm for concurrency in mainstream languages such as </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_(programming_language)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9b3fb32de91343fdaa45b315aa5dc05a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="ffc1667274e346e3ac872cda3b121396"><span data-offset-key="ffc1667274e346e3ac872cda3b121396:0">Java</span></span></span></a><span key="d35770c9f79c44858f03d60cdfa011f0"><span offset-key="d35770c9f79c44858f03d60cdfa011f0:0"> is </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shared_memory" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0660b151eebc4e84a84acefd296b06fd" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="01b3b24b02814512a1d89ca6b162945f"><span data-offset-key="01b3b24b02814512a1d89ca6b162945f:0">shared memory</span></span></span></a><span key="3b7a51ac03df47e9adaa84936deb6c23"><span offset-key="3b7a51ac03df47e9adaa84936deb6c23:0"> concurrency. Concurrent languages that make use of message passing have generally been inspired by process calculi such as </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communicating_sequential_processes" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="dca61012860040c3b268a5bfb8383113" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="6f334870113041ccaafb6a66733af4c8"><span data-offset-key="6f334870113041ccaafb6a66733af4c8:0">communicating sequential processes</span></span></span></a><span key="a057b5c42c8243a4b8e2236bdffcedfa"><span offset-key="a057b5c42c8243a4b8e2236bdffcedfa:0"> (CSP) or the </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%CE%A0-calculus" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="27d095c8b1994a4a82e6b999f844b997" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="5d92b19659e641008bcfb8546195accb"><span data-offset-key="5d92b19659e641008bcfb8546195accb:0">Ï€-calculus</span></span></span></a><span key="9ed13aea89c54a49a48c62e14d679d03"><span offset-key="9ed13aea89c54a49a48c62e14d679d03:0">.</span></span>

<span key="5887c2c4a6f44e28ae87b325a1405674"><span offset-key="5887c2c4a6f44e28ae87b325a1405674:0">Curly-bracket languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8ae70326282a4d7087a31de027e3d970" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="d9cdf4b679e44fd8812bda0ec5dabc04"><span data-offset-key="d9cdf4b679e44fd8812bda0ec5dabc04:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="56f4eb8d795943648c91efa66ae5c8e3"><span offset-key="56f4eb8d795943648c91efa66ae5c8e3:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="ea4bab7b8e064c3690207b8629e44167">**Curly-bracket**<span offset-key="ea4bab7b8e064c3690207b8629e44167:1"> or </span>**curly-brace programming languages**<span offset-key="ea4bab7b8e064c3690207b8629e44167:3"> have a syntax that defines statement blocks using the </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Braces_(punctuation)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6c78695bc9654e6693662366d941527a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="3812e210b7e8433eabea081793fb428a"><span data-offset-key="3812e210b7e8433eabea081793fb428a:0">curly bracket or brace characters </span><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="3812e210b7e8433eabea081793fb428a:1">{</code><span data-offset-key="3812e210b7e8433eabea081793fb428a:2"> and </span><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="3812e210b7e8433eabea081793fb428a:3">}</code></span></span></a><span key="a2db93ce459d423d9b5a4a63c7b9d2d6"><span offset-key="a2db93ce459d423d9b5a4a63c7b9d2d6:0">. This syntax originated with </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BCPL" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="64e518df6f544deeb390d8c5c3ea6e39" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="aef9fe1c03134f78ae06f6e794cc82ee"><span data-offset-key="aef9fe1c03134f78ae06f6e794cc82ee:0">BCPL</span></span></span></a><span key="e411583ebccd4148a03d6a5ceb65a182"><span offset-key="e411583ebccd4148a03d6a5ceb65a182:0"> (1966), and was popularized by </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_(programming_language)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7f38701db02a4fdc922a197878b92595" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="04375d36db3547c6bf40d51c85f0428e"><span data-offset-key="04375d36db3547c6bf40d51c85f0428e:0">C</span></span></span></a><span key="ded10355cbb842abad20a4a700b6e491"><span offset-key="ded10355cbb842abad20a4a700b6e491:0">. ## 

<span key="58fc137ada0749ddbdf4de891a9215ee"><span offset-key="58fc137ada0749ddbdf4de891a9215ee:0">Embeddable languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="160e230a505d41e293852a3b01575e9e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="2e36155205404788af79c48bb962081c"><span data-offset-key="2e36155205404788af79c48bb962081c:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="85bbf337dae74ce29a9ca82c355273c0"><span offset-key="85bbf337dae74ce29a9ca82c355273c0:0">\]</span></span>

### 

<span key="9e3b959a8e0d491387e41d7f0cc20b9b"><span offset-key="9e3b959a8e0d491387e41d7f0cc20b9b:0">In source code\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e3abe85135264aa68e83af833dc3fb75" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="b7169714c4c24c2f95bc35215bef5004"><span data-offset-key="b7169714c4c24c2f95bc35215bef5004:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="9e58091584474d6498a3e503eaa895d6"><span offset-key="9e58091584474d6498a3e503eaa895d6:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="ffeec681fbc64a31aaa3b0ed0d16439c"><span offset-key="ffeec681fbc64a31aaa3b0ed0d16439c:0">Source embeddable languages embed small pieces of executable code inside a piece of free-form text, often a web page.</span></span>

<span key="f9d767cd46c44f6380e29ed4e439b43f"><span offset-key="f9d767cd46c44f6380e29ed4e439b43f:0">Client-side embedded languages are limited by the abilities of the browser or intended client. They aim to provide dynamism to web pages without the need to recontact the server.</span></span>

<span key="aa0a5755a646485ebdd83a02fb3fe149"><span offset-key="aa0a5755a646485ebdd83a02fb3fe149:0">Server-side embedded languages are much more flexible, since almost any language can be built into a server. The aim of having fragments of server-side code embedded in a web page is to generate additional markup dynamically; the code itself disappears when the page is served, to be replaced by its output.</span></span>

<span key="df940ebbceac48f58ef7e63b52c914a8">**Server side\[edit\]**</span>

<span key="715d0c5f38b2475b921ddefbf1eb7f22"><span offset-key="715d0c5f38b2475b921ddefbf1eb7f22:0">In object code\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3f4b19b6aca146c8904b9d7f2a25acb1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="4baa3274cb8a46c6ae7688b45bd39c32"><span data-offset-key="4baa3274cb8a46c6ae7688b45bd39c32:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="d6aecb96ce384528b39e72c3ec9e684a"><span offset-key="d6aecb96ce384528b39e72c3ec9e684a:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="a5be97e6f73141a2970c279b7a9e09ec"><span offset-key="a5be97e6f73141a2970c279b7a9e09ec:0">A wide variety of dynamic or scripting languages can be embedded in compiled executable code. Basically, object code for the language's </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpreter_(computing)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="29f5f5995f63410cb7c5023dd176e239" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="71f09ea26dc84a52a86efe52283357fa"><span data-offset-key="71f09ea26dc84a52a86efe52283357fa:0">interpreter</span></span></span></a><span key="1e5148f5dfd742fcb2aacf3fb268990b"><span offset-key="1e5148f5dfd742fcb2aacf3fb268990b:0"> needs to be linked into the executable. Source code fragments for the embedded language can then be passed to an evaluation function as strings. Application control languages can be implemented this way, if the source code is input by the user. Languages with small interpreters are preferred.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2348d3c010ea47568d12ee6a70a6ba77"><span offset-key="2348d3c010ea47568d12ee6a70a6ba77:0">Hardware description languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=25" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="36566170ef594647bb7fae677d5b192e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="b3dbcb84d90246778fa30a449b6353df"><span data-offset-key="b3dbcb84d90246778fa30a449b6353df:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="f2c1121cd2f04cd28637f2a084515a70"><span offset-key="f2c1121cd2f04cd28637f2a084515a70:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="03e2c3604c374ade95469d60b83bbe61"><span offset-key="03e2c3604c374ade95469d60b83bbe61:0">For a more comprehensive list, see </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_hardware_description_languages" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d9bdd5be7ff9471c867ba316846cdcc1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="0811b82a7355413fb0d9b7fd9959a74b"><span data-offset-key="0811b82a7355413fb0d9b7fd9959a74b:0">List of hardware description languages</span></span></span></a><span key="b3d5b966f6b44afd8bd06089a66d4a07"><span offset-key="b3d5b966f6b44afd8bd06089a66d4a07:0">.</span></span>

<span key="47602ac518d94edfb15a381e6e8f856b"><span offset-key="47602ac518d94edfb15a381e6e8f856b:0">In electronics, a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hardware_description_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6d9d6067d18941b2a527944de3cb58f3" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="154aeb11a3ef4e2d9bfe8bf08e4bed2d"><span data-offset-key="154aeb11a3ef4e2d9bfe8bf08e4bed2d:0">hardware description language</span></span></span></a><span key="01af73eeeb684d428db1b9c1b671c3c7"><span offset-key="01af73eeeb684d428db1b9c1b671c3c7:0"> (HDL) is a specialized computer language used to describe the structure, design, and operation of electronic circuits, and most commonly, digital logic circuits. The two most widely used and well-supported HDL varieties used in industry are </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verilog" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="456bcf2c81c4441d9d7ec7bcc790696d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="d345d418d9e04a139616103fb794ed88"><span data-offset-key="d345d418d9e04a139616103fb794ed88:0">Verilog</span></span></span></a><span key="4bdbc92a2f5c4b8c97f93fa9def02059"><span offset-key="4bdbc92a2f5c4b8c97f93fa9def02059:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VHDL" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="80d8144a4ca14e6eabe8cc29f81f3b4b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="3bf2b5015eae4d65955cf84188a1a63a"><span data-offset-key="3bf2b5015eae4d65955cf84188a1a63a:0">VHDL</span></span></span></a><span key="a07f45e3470444cfaae03efc779a4eee"><span offset-key="a07f45e3470444cfaae03efc779a4eee:0">. Hardware description languages include:</span></span>

###

<span key="f965a6d6bb0349abb7607ec5f0f35098"><span offset-key="f965a6d6bb0349abb7607ec5f0f35098:0">Interactive mode languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=29" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5b14bf0fa9f943cbb65e3c802eb31dc9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="61e0bde9cb7e469ea027b3bfd36e6c9d"><span data-offset-key="61e0bde9cb7e469ea027b3bfd36e6c9d:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="0b1053229e924a81b4990525ed5d79c0"><span offset-key="0b1053229e924a81b4990525ed5d79c0:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="a888bc493470454387ccfe299eca8810"><span offset-key="a888bc493470454387ccfe299eca8810:0">Interactive mode languages act as a kind of shell: expressions or statements can be entered one at a time, and the result of their evaluation is seen immediately. The interactive mode is also termed a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Read%E2%80%93eval%E2%80%93print_loop" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5083545b73e546ad9c54dce8761557be" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="a6e0fa8eb48848aa939b85202616fbac"><span data-offset-key="a6e0fa8eb48848aa939b85202616fbac:0">readâ€“evalâ€“print loop</span></span></span></a><span key="5c42be2283fe457c89080e820cefa181"><span offset-key="5c42be2283fe457c89080e820cefa181:0"> (REPL).</span></span>

## 

<span key="9824e117db174aeea6b3793c78e130c9"><span offset-key="9824e117db174aeea6b3793c78e130c9:0">Machine languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=40" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6e320912baf04490ba8c0b9300f44b18" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="2180d353cf2d467c9dd27964a7606b51"><span data-offset-key="2180d353cf2d467c9dd27964a7606b51:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="e1c82eb401e642d0bdea54967fc3c62a"><span offset-key="e1c82eb401e642d0bdea54967fc3c62a:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="59b9d269c2ab49f5af22fec1a93505b9"><span offset-key="59b9d269c2ab49f5af22fec1a93505b9:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Machine_code" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="dc508688b850491cb1619818edd39b3c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="bd329a4e1fd94489a6f2c098ba12cf0f"><span data-offset-key="bd329a4e1fd94489a6f2c098ba12cf0f:0">Machine languages</span></span></span></a><span key="c8b604981ba5414a8cc84b12de6d854f"><span offset-key="c8b604981ba5414a8cc84b12de6d854f:0"> are directly executable by a computer's CPU. They are typically formulated as bit patterns, usually represented in </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octal" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6f8e208806724c1da0020c1f15fdfe90" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="8ff0355da6ab4bc69e62b7d0eb9cc41c"><span data-offset-key="8ff0355da6ab4bc69e62b7d0eb9cc41c:0">octal</span></span></span></a><span key="45c5b44b58314e4b91a799875b09eaf4"><span offset-key="45c5b44b58314e4b91a799875b09eaf4:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8c05a856324e4007b3558c99ba44b471" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="d6e1b64921cb400caf2cd4aa22b1984b"><span data-offset-key="d6e1b64921cb400caf2cd4aa22b1984b:0">hexadecimal</span></span></span></a><span key="dfd62ab67ed543998beb6aa987436d6f"><span offset-key="dfd62ab67ed543998beb6aa987436d6f:0">. Each bit pattern causes the circuits in the CPU to execute one of the fundamental operations of the hardware. The activation of specific electrical inputs (e.g., CPU package pins for microprocessors), and logical settings for CPU state values, control the processor's computation. Individual machine languages are specific to a family of processors; machine-language code for one family of processors cannot run directly on processors in another family unless the processors in question have additional hardware to support it (for example, DEC VAX processors included a PDP-11 compatibility mode). They are (essentially) always defined by the CPU developer, not by 3rd parties. The symbolic version, the processor's </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assembly_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="18e551930d77484c856092add62f92b4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="306b8cec5b3e417fb5e09ac0ef0136d9"><span data-offset-key="306b8cec5b3e417fb5e09ac0ef0136d9:0">assembly language</span></span></span></a><span key="7a233fad2862463498d91f91cbcef418"><span offset-key="7a233fad2862463498d91f91cbcef418:0">, is also defined by the developer, in most cases. Some commonly used machine code </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Instruction_set" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7c8ff80f25eb475cb7208920edbe54b1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="533da3a653774576b8d70b10840177f7"><span data-offset-key="533da3a653774576b8d70b10840177f7:0">instruction sets</span></span></span></a><span key="3f469faa98844ac4bca171e3272ab0dc"><span offset-key="3f469faa98844ac4bca171e3272ab0dc:0"> are:</span></span>

### 

<span key="72feee921acf4b74945d23f3a6bb4acb"><span offset-key="72feee921acf4b74945d23f3a6bb4acb:0">Textual substitution macro languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=42" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="04727d3b0341482d8bc6a91ef8b2660d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="f2c7e1a8f7e648d9bd6d06067cea6010"><span data-offset-key="f2c7e1a8f7e648d9bd6d06067cea6010:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="23b7e84f021547c3967746350e4cf503"><span offset-key="23b7e84f021547c3967746350e4cf503:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="227f85ac4e664b72b14db6559a7bb0f8"><span offset-key="227f85ac4e664b72b14db6559a7bb0f8:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macro_(computer_science)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4fa6c1a2e6874ef082c6d89628097527" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="2a2bb90f67554f4fb28c5e8ff5d06ea3"><span data-offset-key="2a2bb90f67554f4fb28c5e8ff5d06ea3:0">Macro</span></span></span></a><span key="0b61018e68e34b9dbff03fb2ccd6649c"><span offset-key="0b61018e68e34b9dbff03fb2ccd6649c:0"> languages transform one source code file into another. A "macro" is essentially a short piece of text that expands into a longer one (not to be confused with </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hygienic_macro" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9457cc2f2d3d46d68c1eb4ae3a4edd41" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="625f1fef4c4e41fe8ffc42f66fa23667"><span data-offset-key="625f1fef4c4e41fe8ffc42f66fa23667:0">hygienic macros</span></span></span></a><span key="f37282ac9f2d48d59adb67fc69c37fe0"><span offset-key="f37282ac9f2d48d59adb67fc69c37fe0:0">), possibly with parameter substitution. They are often used to </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Preprocess" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1d4cf334de924296887f7120e4cea754" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="db496644db65446c91bb0248e87629cb"><span data-offset-key="db496644db65446c91bb0248e87629cb:0">preprocess</span></span></span></a><span key="82d772023d9e4ae3928adcb068ef9952"><span offset-key="82d772023d9e4ae3928adcb068ef9952:0"> source code. Preprocessors can also supply facilities like </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Include_directive" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2a9af20cffd247b096c9cbb37d972ec4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="113fc9fda0e94de08929ca3c3101bf29"><span data-offset-key="113fc9fda0e94de08929ca3c3101bf29:0">file inclusion</span></span></span></a><span key="2b19750913eb4d8faff8eb820c95ddff"><span offset-key="2b19750913eb4d8faff8eb820c95ddff:0">.</span></span>

<span key="626ee1551fc04ca5a2b9e2b9801ac2b8"><span offset-key="626ee1551fc04ca5a2b9e2b9801ac2b8:0">Macro languages may be restricted to acting on specially labeled code regions (pre-fixed with a </span>`#`<span offset-key="626ee1551fc04ca5a2b9e2b9801ac2b8:2"> in the case of the C preprocessor). Alternatively, they may not, but in this case it is still often undesirable to (for instance) expand a macro embedded in a </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/String_literal" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2991cc31e37b4a4981793a618ea465cb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="7760e097bab34896895932279b616db7"><span data-offset-key="7760e097bab34896895932279b616db7:0">string literal</span></span></span></a><span key="35910b391b8f461481f3dfa53c464c8f"><span offset-key="35910b391b8f461481f3dfa53c464c8f:0">, so they still need a rudimentary awareness of syntax. That being the case, they are often still applicable to more than one language. Contrast with source-embeddable languages like </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PHP" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="41463a31803f434293a3243e5eb955dc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="f597dc1b36fc4bb29a7df1a332d7368a"><span data-offset-key="f597dc1b36fc4bb29a7df1a332d7368a:0">PHP</span></span></span></a><span key="9974abaf8a45464085066a4334fc2ca5"><span offset-key="9974abaf8a45464085066a4334fc2ca5:0">, which are fully featured.</span></span>

<span key="e12a8c27cad74511b8ef112baf657c09"><span offset-key="e12a8c27cad74511b8ef112baf657c09:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">â€‹</span></span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metaprogramming" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8adfafcf675b4778814e2f9817c75fd7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="0f2ad9d8636f4841ab74b0a32f0f4895"><span data-offset-key="0f2ad9d8636f4841ab74b0a32f0f4895:0">Metaprogramming</span></span></span></a><span key="c9615d0f8066452fbf51020be614c363"><span offset-key="c9615d0f8066452fbf51020be614c363:0"> is the writing of programs that write or manipulate other programs, including themselves, as their data or that do part of the work that is otherwise done at </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Run_time_(program_lifecycle_phase)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="72ca5e6113d74873970e73e374c04079" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="21dec232f3e24a8d9b837ac74d12d5a8"><span data-offset-key="21dec232f3e24a8d9b837ac74d12d5a8:0">run time</span></span></span></a><span key="e02d23a6151e423485ee9bb75066edb7"><span offset-key="e02d23a6151e423485ee9bb75066edb7:0"> during </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compile_time" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="016a879455664bf6bcd0995bba1d3690" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="e7fee946f1954691981dcdd83494e3c3"><span data-offset-key="e7fee946f1954691981dcdd83494e3c3:0">compile time</span></span></span></a><span key="9d36a1915fe14c0d839aef2807fc3339"><span offset-key="9d36a1915fe14c0d839aef2807fc3339:0">. ## 

<span key="35da1d25c24a4e509e122e5cc3c6800a"><span offset-key="35da1d25c24a4e509e122e5cc3c6800a:0">Object-oriented class-based languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=48" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fe19fac7bea540b5bba21250732051b7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="be8ebadf7a83484ea5db94a40414467f"><span data-offset-key="be8ebadf7a83484ea5db94a40414467f:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="65cd0418a191429e86582c9fd5df5fc2"><span offset-key="65cd0418a191429e86582c9fd5df5fc2:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="6796c07827d843fa92eaa89e55c1ef30"><span offset-key="6796c07827d843fa92eaa89e55c1ef30:0">Class-based </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object-oriented_programming_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0daf5eab2a844ea0b815b5b5838520f4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="018f04359d624bea925d1b261fb464aa"><span data-offset-key="018f04359d624bea925d1b261fb464aa:0">Object-oriented programming languages</span></span></span></a><span key="13aef1add73d4398a4a163269154380d"><span offset-key="13aef1add73d4398a4a163269154380d:0"> support objects defined by their class. Class definitions include member data. </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Message_passing" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1e6b24aad7aa4ffa9f62f3bff0b2355f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="013f0a3a7e4f457db15caa4761e0aceb"><span data-offset-key="013f0a3a7e4f457db15caa4761e0aceb:0">Message passing</span></span></span></a><span key="6ba14cb82a5f4f629e9a11e9b8781cef"><span offset-key="6ba14cb82a5f4f629e9a11e9b8781cef:0"> is a key concept (if not the key concept) in Object-oriented languages.</span></span>

<span key="7f4a25a18820465fa01bd9dcf40832ef"><span offset-key="7f4a25a18820465fa01bd9dcf40832ef:0">Polymorphic functions parameterized by the class of some of their arguments are typically called methods. In languages with </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_dispatch" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="dd8c2f9b8343445f8e7027a93bd3bee1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="447e7c7bbea94519939ba9abab81967d"><span data-offset-key="447e7c7bbea94519939ba9abab81967d:0">single dispatch</span></span></span></a><span key="502128463914464e989ff92fb52f2a1c"><span offset-key="502128463914464e989ff92fb52f2a1c:0">, classes typically also include method definitions. In languages with </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiple_dispatch" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="bd9f5d811c8b460187169e6f970a2f67" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="50e23bbacf7a4d1a8a412ba0c66cc91a"><span data-offset-key="50e23bbacf7a4d1a8a412ba0c66cc91a:0">multiple dispatch</span></span></span></a><span key="bfcb2ddf4dc948a7a2a6455c5ec49328"><span offset-key="bfcb2ddf4dc948a7a2a6455c5ec49328:0">, methods are defined by </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_function" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="acfeb6e753b94168bc651aa711380d96" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="75ee0d21b5f8447580fa089620879dc4"><span data-offset-key="75ee0d21b5f8447580fa089620879dc4:0">generic functions</span></span></span></a><span key="c1c86d0aa34c4eb7aec8c80336570db1"><span offset-key="c1c86d0aa34c4eb7aec8c80336570db1:0">. There are exceptions where </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_dispatch" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f41cdd524bfe4cd38e37dd4babafdbdd" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="bbc558df01c1442685eb308c5b27df32"><span data-offset-key="bbc558df01c1442685eb308c5b27df32:0">single dispatch</span></span></span></a><span key="40f46bec4b424284bba2af25e19cac21"><span offset-key="40f46bec4b424284bba2af25e19cac21:0"> methods are </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generic_function" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e83d27a5e1b64ed6b749bb18c67780de" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="d73f803630e148b49a84fa39dd330917"><span data-offset-key="d73f803630e148b49a84fa39dd330917:0">generic functions</span></span></span></a><span key="fcd7e5fc43f941b49569fa8ff4331598"><span offset-key="fcd7e5fc43f941b49569fa8ff4331598:0"> (e.g. </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bigloo" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d226f089e31241f889b50cbc5ccb0a41" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="ad1718954e7c4d6abf9ce9f628bcaf71"><span data-offset-key="ad1718954e7c4d6abf9ce9f628bcaf71:0">Bigloo</span></span></span></a><span key="3adfa91576834be48336f49abf94c417"><span offset-key="3adfa91576834be48336f49abf94c417:0">'s object system).</span></span>

<span key="546cdebd85864d8d87fdf1583ab78978"><span offset-key="546cdebd85864d8d87fdf1583ab78978:0">Procedural languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=53" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3d94769908324075a926d8514c996ede" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="282491416bd5405fa02a2e7988589d64"><span data-offset-key="282491416bd5405fa02a2e7988589d64:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="8b6ba405f9ad491789c8db7cf0729c39"><span offset-key="8b6ba405f9ad491789c8db7cf0729c39:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="59996249d9c043c3a1b65dffe5cbe248"><span offset-key="59996249d9c043c3a1b65dffe5cbe248:0">Reflective Language\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=55" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3052c05583d7490d960121b28410e12b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="84f179a055a9416ea338d098112de0a9"><span data-offset-key="84f179a055a9416ea338d098112de0a9:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="c6c56b063fca4eb18567b0b2067754fe"><span offset-key="c6c56b063fca4eb18567b0b2067754fe:0">\]</span></span>

## 

<span key="f9be119d78264927b2fc532add404295"><span offset-key="f9be119d78264927b2fc532add404295:0">Scripting languages\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=57" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6d7478c704134b5c8ff4b37f00658fc7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="bcf0f87b05924679a227ebb0061a5b75"><span data-offset-key="bcf0f87b05924679a227ebb0061a5b75:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="1f4ee233cdfd493eadcc9d0dc0c5a77c"><span offset-key="1f4ee233cdfd493eadcc9d0dc0c5a77c:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="183ebeb557b44577ab97de2ae62eafd0"><span offset-key="183ebeb557b44577ab97de2ae62eafd0:0">"</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scripting_language" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="baefc72d1f8a4674935f21637aa20623" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="14907d3506d84fdab6735cfee4f32547"><span data-offset-key="14907d3506d84fdab6735cfee4f32547:0">Scripting language</span></span></span></a><span key="50ae07e01f6048f9b13f786e2fb9bc8c"><span offset-key="50ae07e01f6048f9b13f786e2fb9bc8c:0">" has two apparently different, but in fact similar, meanings. In a traditional sense, scripting languages are designed to automate frequently used tasks that usually involve calling or passing commands to external programs. Many complex application programs provide built-in languages that let users automate tasks. Those that are </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interpreter_(computing)" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b7f7b2b9704d43f3a5f0a277730a0fd6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="5cf533152e574f168738cb045cb8b01d"><span data-offset-key="5cf533152e574f168738cb045cb8b01d:0">interpretive</span></span></span></a><span key="f2a6821007ad4f55bc147f914ab9fcd3"><span offset-key="f2a6821007ad4f55bc147f914ab9fcd3:0"> are often called scripting languages.</span></span>

<span key="82538b8745594e808a899ffeb818e3b7"><span offset-key="82538b8745594e808a899ffeb818e3b7:0">Recently, many applications have built-in traditional scripting languages, such as </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perl" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="44d46db846314b06976eb200a28b228d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="deebc34bfa864177ba5c0558e1c354a2"><span data-offset-key="deebc34bfa864177ba5c0558e1c354a2:0">Perl</span></span></span></a><span key="eed8dadaa85344b78eaa6f6b41f6217c"><span offset-key="eed8dadaa85344b78eaa6f6b41f6217c:0"> or </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visual_Basic" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="65f3a73ed1964ae590c5bf6f1cda1bfc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="4e8b17c89cd548e888f893b31bbb3339"><span data-offset-key="4e8b17c89cd548e888f893b31bbb3339:0">Visual Basic</span></span></span></a><span key="726b4414c6294e568d5d1d4218fbf2e0"><span offset-key="726b4414c6294e568d5d1d4218fbf2e0:0">, but there are quite a few native scripting languages still in use. Many scripting languages are compiled to bytecode and then this (usually) platform-independent bytecode is run through a virtual machine (compare to </span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_virtual_machine" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="60a508ff219846b5a24e346652fe385d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="f72c85f0480a46c292bdab8a0fe96771"><span data-offset-key="f72c85f0480a46c292bdab8a0fe96771:0">Java virtual machine</span></span></span></a><span key="1e09471a029441f5a416e148b12042d9"><span offset-key="1e09471a029441f5a416e148b12042d9:0">).</span></span>

### 

<span key="8a349e02ed7a4afea1c6abe0299c55ed"><span offset-key="8a349e02ed7a4afea1c6abe0299c55ed:0">Real-time rendering\[</span></span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_programming_languages_by_type&amp;action=edit&amp;section=61" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1350ddbc66994c5aa78f776e2c1cdb10" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-88518_259-88519-237__"><span data-key="f80ec32608464741b8a4ccf3b70f0318"><span data-offset-key="f80ec32608464741b8a4ccf3b70f0318:0">edit</span></span></span></a><span key="69180cf50ad34f37b4fa57e12094c651"><span offset-key="69180cf50ad34f37b4fa57e12094c651:0">\]</span></span>

<span key="40fd307f100e4b5fbd14d07a7a5667c5"><span offset-key="40fd307f100e4b5fbd14d07a7a5667c5:0">They provide both higher hardware abstraction and a more flexible programming model than previous paradigms which hardcoded transformation and shading equations. This gives the programmer greater control over the rendering process and delivers richer content at lower overhead.</span></span>

<span key="aa0959aaf6794dd4b01540aaed186318"><span offset-key="aa0959aaf6794dd4b01540aaed186318:0">The </span>**system programming languages**<span offset-key="aa0959aaf6794dd4b01540aaed186318:2"> are for low level tasks like memory management or task management. A system programming language usually refers to a programming language used for system programming; such languages are designed for writing system software, which usually requires different development approaches when compared with application software.</span></span>

<span key="3c7a0db4b2dd41ac8ede941248f79507"><span offset-key="3c7a0db4b2dd41ac8ede941248f79507:0">System software is computer software designed to operate and control the computer hardware, and to provide a platform for running application software. System software includes software categories such as operating systems, utility software, device drivers, compilers, and linkers. Examples of system languages include:</span></span>
